Package Brick.Break.Wall.Levels

Class LevelsCreation

java.lang.Object
Brick.Break.Wall.Levels.LevelsCreation
public class LevelsCreation
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used to create types of level. The methods in this class was extracted from the "Wall" class.

  • Method Details

    • makeSingleTypeLevel

      public BrickController[] makeSingleTypeLevel​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int brickCnt, int lineCnt, double brickSizeRatio, int type)
      This method is to design the layout of the bricks in a level. In this case, there is only one brick type that is needed in this level. Therefore, there is no pattern on how the bricks is placed in this level.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The size of the game.
      brickCnt - The total amount of the bricks in a level.
      lineCnt - The total layer of the bricks in a level.
      brickSizeRatio - The ratio size of each brick.
      type - The types of the brick.

    • makeChessboardLevel

      public BrickController[] makeChessboardLevel​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int brickCnt, int lineCnt, double brickSizeRatio, int typeA, int typeB)
      This method is to design the layout of the bricks in a level. In this case, there will be two brick type that is needed in a level. Therefore, the bricks will be placed in chessboard pattern in a level.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The size of the game.
      brickCnt - The total amount of the bricks in a level.
      lineCnt - The total layer of the bricks in a level.
      brickSizeRatio - The ratio size of each brick.
      typeA - The types of the first brick.
      typeB - The second type of the brick.

    • makeLevels

      protected BrickController[][] makeLevels​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio)
      This method is used to lay out the bricks onto each level. I added three more levels in this method for this game. The fifth level will be all steel bricks. The sixth level will be steel bricks and gold bricks which will be placed in a chessboard pattern. The seventh level is all gold bricks and additional two layers.
      Parameters:
      drawArea - The size of the game.
      brickCount - The total amount of the bricks in a level.
      lineCount - The total layer of bricks in a level.
      brickDimensionRatio - The ratio of brick size in a level.
